programme.desc: Milo is a young cub in the mighty Mwamba pride, which rules a territory on the west bank of the Luangwa River. 20-strong it's ruled by the notorious Punks, a coalition of three strong brothers, it's the largest pride for miles around, giving Milo the best start in life. But, in lion society, cubs are the glue that binds a pride.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: To win the game of life, it can take more than brute force. Animals with a super-powered sixth sense can get the edge on fast-moving prey, beat the elements, and find food in unlikely places.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: Animals wage a covert war for survival, deploying their hidden weapons with deadly precision. These adaptations, forged by eons of evolution, give animals the edge they need to outwit predators, rivals, and the elements. From the bombardier beetle's boiling spray to the mantis shrimp's explosive club and the draco lizard‚Äôs hidden wings, meet nature's awesome secret weapons.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: The Pol‚Äôs are preparing for sheep to give birth, which means figuring out how to catch and shear their four Merino ewes ‚Äì no small task as this is new territory for everyone except Dr. Pol. Then, while helping his dad on a farm call, Charles has a terrifying accident. The whole family rallies together to care for Charles and take care of the farm.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It‚Äôs been a year of farming for the Pol family. Even with Charles recovering from his injury, the farm‚Äôs showing no signs of slowing down! Beth takes the next step with her bees to grow the colony and harvest honey. Charles and Ben come up with a final fix for the sheep hut‚Äôs drainage problem. The whole family comes together to plant the garden and celebrate a successful year on the farm.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the constant heat, humidity and rainfall of the Australian rainforests to find out what it takes to be ‚ÄúBuilt to Survive.‚Äù In the leafy canopy, Phil encounters the elusive tree kangaroo and its young joey, as well as Australia‚Äôs largest snake, the lethal scrub python. On the forest floor, the colorful cassowary acts as the rainforest‚Äôs gardener.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Asia's Killer Hornets
programme.desc: Every Asian giant hornet colony starts with a single queen. Leaving one hive to start another, she‚Äôll quickly transform an empty lair into a bustling army of ruthless, efficient killing machines. These hornets will sacrifice everything to help raise legions of grubs and protect the hive at all costs.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol searches for clues to why a python has lumps under her skin. Dr. Nicole discovers the surprising cause of a cat‚Äôs sky-high fever, and Dr. Lisa sutures a dog‚Äôs puncture wound. In the parking lot, alpacas get their shots and a goose gets loose. Dr. Pol is asked by a local baseball team to throw out the first pitch. To warm up his arm, Dr. Pol plays catch with Charles and Abigail.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol performs emergency surgery on a dog that swallowed a rope toy. Dr. Nicole examines a tiny kitten with a big eye problem, and Dr. Lisa helps a horse suffering from heaves. A fungal infection glows on a Pomeranian while a lump grows on a Pitbull. The Pols celebrate their 55th wedding anniversary with cake decorated by grandkids, Silas and Abigail.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: From the dark of morning to the black of night, the vets are moooving. Dr. Pol wrestles to save a calf and mamma cow in a troubled labor. Dr. Nicole sutures her way through two ducks wounded from an attack, and a dog with a torn ear. Dr. Lisa investigates a rare paw problem, while a chihuahua‚Äôs chest x-ray exposes a hidden issue. Every day is indeed.. all it‚Äôs quacked up to be.

programme.title: When Predators Attack
programme.desc: Watch what unfolds when the world's most venomous snakes and largest constrictors face off against prey and people.

programme.title: When Predators Attack

programme.title: When Predators Attack

programme.title: Wild Hunters: Deadly Killers of Africa
programme.desc: Journey across Africa exploring the continent's most iconic and deadliest predators. These African stories are a show of raw power, strength and endurance. An awe-inspiring display of the fierce, everyday battles fought in the wild.

programme.title: World's Creepiest Killers
programme.desc: Giant spiders. Voracious blobs. Swamp things. It's the stuff of horror movies. But these creepy killers are real. And sometimes fact is stranger than fiction.

programme.title: Killer Safari
programme.desc: The lines between hunter and hunted become blurred in this epic safari. Hold on to your seats as an elephant charges through the bush with a lion dangling from its tusks. Watch as male leopards engage in a turf war, and a pack of hyenas bully a lion off of his buffalo kill. The safari intensifies as a leopard, wild dogs and hyenas fight for the same kill in an astonishing display of raw nature.
